programme.title: Mission Majnu
programme.desc: Set against the backdrop of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971, the film follows Amandeep Singh, a RAW agent operating undercover in Pakistan. As he uncovers Pakistan's nuclear ambitions, he must navigate personal and professional challenges to complete his mission.

programme.title: Dream Girl
programme.desc: Karamveer Singh, a young man with an unusual ability to mimic a woman’s voice, lands a job at a friendship call center where he poses as "Pooja." His growing popularity among lonely men—including a cop, a spoiled brat, and even a local goon—spirals into chaos as they all fall in love with "Pooja," unaware of her true identity. The film is a comedy that touches on loneliness, societal pressures, and identity.

programme.title: URI - The Surgical Strike
programme.desc: Inspired by true events, URI – The Surgical Strike chronicles the Indian Army’s 2016 surgical strike on terror launchpads across the Line of Control in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Led by Major Vihaan Singh Shergill, the mission is carried out as retaliation for the deadly Uri base camp attack. With intense training, strategic execution, and nationalistic fervor, the film is a gripping military action drama showcasing courage and patriotism.

programme.title: Dream Girl
programme.desc: Karamveer Singh, a young man with an unusual ability to mimic a woman’s voice, lands a job at a friendship call center where he poses as "Pooja." His growing popularity among lonely men—including a cop, a spoiled brat, and even a local goon—spirals into chaos as they all fall in love with "Pooja," unaware of her true identity. The film is a comedy that touches on loneliness, societal pressures, and identity.

programme.title: URI - The Surgical Strike
programme.desc: Inspired by true events, URI – The Surgical Strike chronicles the Indian Army’s 2016 surgical strike on terror launchpads across the Line of Control in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Led by Major Vihaan Singh Shergill, the mission is carried out as retaliation for the deadly Uri base camp attack. With intense training, strategic execution, and nationalistic fervor, the film is a gripping military action drama showcasing courage and patriotism.

programme.title: Dream Girl
programme.desc: Karamveer Singh, a young man with an unusual ability to mimic a woman’s voice, lands a job at a friendship call center where he poses as "Pooja." His growing popularity among lonely men—including a cop, a spoiled brat, and even a local goon—spirals into chaos as they all fall in love with "Pooja," unaware of her true identity. The film is a comedy that touches on loneliness, societal pressures, and identity.

programme.title: Article 15
programme.desc: Article 15 is a hard-hitting investigative drama inspired by real events, focusing on the caste-based injustices prevalent in India. When a young Dalit girl is found murdered and another goes missing, a newly posted IPS officer, Ayan Ranjan (played by Ayushmann Khurrana), takes on the case. As he digs deeper, he is faced with bureaucratic resistance, local hostility, and systemic corruption. The film, directed by Anubhav Sinha, is a powerful commentary on the social divide and is titled after the Indian Constitution's Article 15, which prohibits discrimination on the grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth.

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Directed by Abbas Mustan, Race features Saif Ali Khan and Akshaye Khanna as rival brothers in the horse racing business. With twists and turns at every corner, the film delves into themes of greed and betrayal, keeping audiences guessing until the end.
